document_name_accent: ung thu vom hong giai doan dau.json
document_title: Early stage nasopharyngeal cancer: Signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
The survival rate of a type of cancer, which can be understood in a simple way, is the percentage of people with that type of cancer who are still alive within a certain period of time (usually 5 years). ) after diagnosis and treatment. This rate does not indicate specifically how long a person with the disease will live, but can help better understand the likely success of treatment. The earlier cancer is diagnosed, the higher the chance of successful treatment, which means the higher the survival rate.
Patients with early-stage nasopharyngeal cancer often have good results, with a 5-year survival rate of 60-75%. While patients with stage IV nasopharyngeal cancer have poor outcomes, the 5-year survival rate is <40%. (2)
subsection_title: ung thu vom hong giai doan dau.json. Prognosis of early-stage nasopharyngeal cancer
